      com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Double> getIoWaitPercentageGauge()
      Retrieves a recent UNIX iowait (percentage of CPU blocked for IO) value as reported in the output for the iostat command.

      Retrieves the recent CPU usage for the JVM process.

      Retrieves the maximum number of file descriptors.

      Retrieves the UNIX system load average for the past minute.

      Retrieves the UNIX system load average for the past minute divided by the number of logical processors.

      • getAvailableLogicalProcessorsGauge

        public com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Integer> getAvailableLogicalProcessorsGauge()
        Description copied from interface: OperatingSystemStatus
        Retrieves the number of logical processors as observed by the JVM. Logical processors are individual cores, summed up for all sockets and, possibly, multiplied by a factor of two whenever Intel's hyper-threading technology is in play.
        Specified by:
        getAvailableLogicalProcessorsGauge in interface OperatingSystemStatus
        Returns:
        a gauge holding the number of logical processors as observed by the JVM.
        See Also:
        OperatingSystemMXBean.getAvailableProcessors()

        Specified by:
        getSystemLoadAverageGauge in interface OperatingSystemStatus
        Returns:
        a gauge holding the system load average for the past minute; null if not available.
        See Also:
        OperatingSystemMXBean.getSystemLoadAverage()

      • getSystemLoadAveragePerLogicalProcessorGauge

      • getJvmCpuBusyPercentageGauge

        public com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Double> getJvmCpuBusyPercentageGauge()
        Description copied from interface: OperatingSystemStatus
        Retrieves the recent CPU usage for the JVM process. The returned value is in the range from 0 to 100.
        Specified by:
        getJvmCpuBusyPercentageGauge in interface OperatingSystemStatus
        Returns:
        a gauge holding the percentage of the time CPU was busy recently running JVM threads; null if not available.
        See Also:
        OperatingSystemMXBean.getProcessCpuLoad()
